title: fa.functional analysis - An algebraic property that makes a per-C*-algebra complete
body: Let $A$ be a normed *-algebra with $\|x^*x\|=\|x\|^2$ . Suppose that for every subset S of A, the left annihilator ${\displaystyle \mathrm {Ann} _{L}(S)=\{a\in A\mid \forall s\in S,as=0\}\,}$ is generated as a left ideal by some projection p of A. Q. Is $A$ norm complete (i.e., an AW*-algebra)? fa.functional-analysis oa.operator-algebras c-star-algebras Share Cite Improve this question Follow asked Jun 19, 2020 at 5:40 ABB 4,150 1 1 gold badge 13 13 silver badges 19 19 bronze badges $\endgroup$ 2 2 $\begingroup$ How about the subalgebra of those functions in $\ell_\infty({\bf N})$ that take only finitely many values? $\endgroup$ Narutaka OZAWA –  Narutaka OZAWA 2020-06-19 06:16:34 +00:00 Commented Jun 19, 2020 at 6:16 $\begingroup$ Yes, it is a nice countra-example.
